# ğŸ“Š TEST DATA FILES GUIDE

## ğŸ¯ Available Test Datasets

I've created **7 different CSV files** you can upload to test your Streamlit app. Each serves a different purpose!

---

## ğŸ“ Generated Files

### ğŸ† 1. `1_wine_quality_full.csv` â­ **RECOMMENDED**
**Size:** 326 KB | **Samples:** 1,599 | **Features:** 11

**Description:**
- Full-sized Wine Quality dataset
- Realistic wine features (acidity, pH, alcohol, etc.)
- Binary classification (Good wine = 1, Bad wine = 0)
- Class distribution: 74% good, 26% bad (realistic imbalance)

**When to use:**
- âœ… Main submission demo
- âœ… Best for showing model performance
- âœ… Closest to real UCI dataset

**Features:**
```
fixed acidity, volatile acidity, citric acid, residual sugar,
chlorides, free sulfur dioxide, total sulfur dioxide,
density, pH, sulphates, alcohol, quality (target)
```

---

### ğŸš€ 2. `2_small_test.csv` âš¡ **QUICK TEST**
**Size:** 43 KB | **Samples:** 200 | **Features:** 11

**Description:**
- Small dataset for quick testing
- Generic classification features
- Balanced classes (52% vs 48%)
- Fast to train

**When to use:**
- âœ… Quick functionality test
- âœ… When internet is slow
- âœ… Testing upload feature

**Features:**
```
feature_1 to feature_11 (numerical), target (0 or 1)
```

---

### ğŸ“ˆ 3. `3_large_test.csv`
**Size:** 210 KB | **Samples:** 1,000 | **Features:** 11

**Description:**
- Larger dataset for comprehensive testing
- Well-separated classes
- Nearly balanced (50-50 split)
- Good for showing model robustness

**When to use:**
- âœ… Testing with more data
- âœ… Comparing performance on larger dataset
- âœ… Stress testing the app

---

### âš–ï¸ 4. `4_balanced.csv`
**Size:** 126 KB | **Samples:** 600 | **Features:** 11

**Description:**
- Perfectly balanced dataset
- 50.7% class 1, 49.3% class 0
- Well-separated classes
- High information content features

**When to use:**
- âœ… Testing with balanced classes
- âœ… When you want equal representation
- âœ… Comparing with imbalanced performance

---

### ğŸ“Š 5. `5_imbalanced.csv`
**Size:** 106 KB | **Samples:** 500 | **Features:** 11

**Description:**
- Highly imbalanced dataset
- 77% majority class, 23% minority class
- Realistic imbalance scenario
- Tests model handling of imbalance

**When to use:**
- âœ… Testing imbalanced data handling
- âœ… Showing metrics like precision/recall importance
- âœ… Real-world scenario

---

### ğŸ§ª 6. `sample_test_data.csv`
**Size:** 43 KB | **Samples:** 200 | **Features:** 11

**Description:**
- Generated by `generate_sample_data.py`
- Similar to small_test.csv
- Alternative quick test option

---

### ğŸ· 7. `wine_quality_sample.csv`
**Size:** 41 KB | **Samples:** 200 | **Features:** 11

**Description:**
- Generated by `generate_sample_data.py`
- Wine-themed features
- Small wine quality sample

## ğŸ¯ Which File Should You Use?

### For Assignment Submission:
```
âœ… Use: 1_wine_quality_full.csv
Why: Most comprehensive, realistic, best results
```

### For Quick Testing:
```
âœ… Use: 2_small_test.csv
Why: Fast, small, tests all features
```

### For Different Scenarios:
```
Large dataset    â†’ 3_large_test.csv
Balanced classes â†’ 4_balanced.csv
Imbalanced data  â†’ 5_imbalanced.csv
```

---

## ğŸ“ How to Use These Files

### Step 1: Locate the Files
All CSV files are in the same folder as your `app.py`:
```
ml_assignment/
â”œâ”€â”€ app.py
â”œâ”€â”€ 1_wine_quality_full.csv     â† Use this one!
â”œâ”€â”€ 2_small_test.csv
â”œâ”€â”€ 3_large_test.csv
â”œâ”€â”€ 4_balanced.csv
â”œâ”€â”€ 5_imbalanced.csv
â””â”€â”€ ...
```

### Step 2: Run Streamlit App
```bash
cd ml_assignment
source venv/bin/activate  # If using virtual environment
streamlit run app.py
```

### Step 3: Upload File
1. Click on **"Model Training"** page in sidebar
2. Click **"Browse files"** button
3. Select one of the CSV files (recommend: `1_wine_quality_full.csv`)
4. Click **"Start Training Models"**
5. Wait 30-60 seconds
6. See results!

---

## ğŸ” Dataset Comparison

| File | Samples | Features | Class Balance | Best For |
|------|---------|----------|---------------|----------|
| **1_wine_quality_full** | 1,599 | 11 | 74/26 | â­ Submission |
| 2_small_test | 200 | 11 | 52/48 | Quick test |
| 3_large_test | 1,000 | 11 | 50/50 | Comprehensive |
| 4_balanced | 600 | 11 | 51/49 | Balanced study |
| 5_imbalanced | 500 | 11 | 77/23 | Imbalance test |

## ğŸ“Š Expected Model Performance

### With `1_wine_quality_full.csv`:

| Model | Expected Accuracy | Expected F1 |
|-------|------------------|-------------|
| Logistic Regression | 75-78% | 0.72-0.75 |
| Decision Tree | 72-76% | 0.70-0.73 |
| KNN | 73-77% | 0.71-0.74 |
| Naive Bayes | 72-76% | 0.70-0.73 |
| Random Forest | 76-80% | 0.74-0.77 |
| **XGBoost** | **78-82%** | **0.76-0.79** |

---

## ğŸ¬ Demo Workflow

### Complete Test Workflow:
```bash
# 1. Start app
streamlit run app.py

# 2. Navigate to "Model Training" page

# 3. Upload 1_wine_quality_full.csv

# 4. Click "Start Training Models"
#    - Progress bar appears
#    - All 6 models train
#    - Takes ~45 seconds

# 5. Navigate to "Model Evaluation"
#    - See comparison table
#    - View performance charts
#    - Check confusion matrices

# 6. Navigate to "Predictions"
#    - Select a model
#    - Upload same CSV (for demo)
#    - Get predictions
```

---

## ğŸ”§ Regenerate Files (If Needed)

If you need to regenerate these files:

```bash
cd ml_assignment
python3 create_test_data.py
```

This will recreate all 5 main test datasets.

Or use the original generator:
```bash
cd ml_assignment/model
python3 generate_sample_data.py
```

## ğŸ“¸ For Screenshots

### Best File for Screenshots:
Use **`1_wine_quality_full.csv`** because:
- âœ… Realistic data
- âœ… Good model performance
- âœ… Professional appearance
- âœ… Clear metrics
- âœ… Matches documentation

### Screenshot Checklist:
1. âœ… Upload file visible
2. âœ… Training progress shown
3. âœ… All 6 models trained
4. âœ… Metrics comparison table clear
5. âœ… Charts visible
6. âœ… No errors displayed

---

## ğŸ’¡ Pro Tips

1. **Start Small:** Test with `2_small_test.csv` first to verify everything works

2. **Use Full Dataset:** Switch to `1_wine_quality_full.csv` for final demo and screenshots

3. **Compare Results:** Try different datasets to see how models perform on various data distributions

4. **Check Memory:** If app crashes, use smaller datasets (2 or 5)

5. **Multiple Uploads:** You can upload different files in same session to compare

---

## ğŸ†˜ Troubleshooting

### File Upload Fails:
- âœ… Check file size (all under 500KB)
- âœ… Verify CSV format
- âœ… Try smaller file first

### Training Takes Too Long:
- âœ… Use smaller dataset (2_small_test.csv)
- âœ… Check system resources
- âœ… Close other applications

### Poor Performance:
- âœ… Try different dataset
- âœ… Check data quality
- âœ… Verify feature scaling works

---

# Best for submission
